intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis schnitteri, commonly known as the Schneiter's orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture from the air and decaying organic matter. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
